(44) 266.24th May, 1944.WAR CABINET.EQUAL PAY.Memorandum by the Prime Minister.THE Chancellor of the Exchequer has provided me with information aboutthe additional cost of giving equal pay to men and women in the non-industrialclasses for which the Exchequer is responsible financially either in whole or inpart. The figures for the present day are approximate only, while those for thepost-war period are necessarily based on certain assumptions and must be treated with great reserve.Total Additional Annual Cost.Present Time. Post- War. m. Mm.1. Teachers ............ 11-5 182. Civil Service ............ 13 73. Women's Services (A.T.S., W.A.A.F.,W.R.N.S.) ............ 15 (negligible)4. Civil Defence (including N.F.S. and auxiliary Police) ... ... ... 4 (negligible)43-5 25About one-half of the cost for teachers, both now and after the war, would fall on local authorities. The remaining cost for teachers, and the whole of thecost for the other classes, would fall on the Exchequer.w. s. c.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1.24th May, 1944.Printed for the War Cabinet.
